member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment
member.summary: The TextAlignment Enumeration describes the different horizontal alignment values that can be used to display text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Left
member.summary: The Text is Left-Aligned, appearing closest to the left-most edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Center
member.summary: The Text is centered between the left and right edge of the container.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: The text is Right-Aligned, appearing closest to the right-most edge.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect
member.summary: The ExpandEffect values can be used to describe how the Panel will expand and collapse. When set to None, the panel content will simply appear or disappear. All other values describe special effects.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect.None
member.summary: The content will simply appear or disappear. No special effect will be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.ExpandEffect.Slide
member.summary: The content will roll-up, or unroll based on whether it is collapsing or expanding. On supported browsers (Currently only Internet Exploerer), the content will also slowly fade to and from transparent while also rolling up or down.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Display
member.summary: The value applied to the display attribute of style object of the WebAsyncRefreshPanel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Display.NotSet
member.summary: The value for display of the DIV HTML element which represents the panel is not set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Display.Block
member.summary: Panel is rendered as a block element.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Display.Inline
member.summary: Panel is rendered as an inline element.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.Display.None
member.summary: Panel is invisible on client. Though it is present in html on the client and keeps all functionality related to linked asynchronous hidden postback.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType
member.summary: The type of overflow child controls in WebAsyncRefreshPanel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType.NotSet
member.summary: The overflow attribute is not set to the DIV HTML element.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType.Visible
member.summary: The child controls are visible: no automatic scrollbars.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType.Scroll
member.summary: The scrollbars are always displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType.Hidden
member.summary: The scrollbars are never displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.OverflowType.Auto
member.summary: The scrollbars are displayed automatically if they are needed.

A flag indicating whether this renderer will be used for Design-Time functionality

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.PrepareStyleDefaults
member.summary: PrepareStyleDefaults is called from Control.OnPreRender(). It is your last chance to modify any of the styles, or CssStyleClass objects, before they are written to the page.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.RegisterAllCssClasses
member.summary: Registers all Css classes needed by the owner control, with the page.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.RegisterGeneralJavaScript
member.summary: Registers any JavaScript files needed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.GetAllClassesAndRegisterGenerics
member.summary: Returns the Style element that contains all CSS classes needed for the owner control. This method will also register any "Generic" css classes (classes containing default style information), needed for every control of the owners type.
member.returns: The style tag which will be added to the Page which contains the owner control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.WriteCssClassesAndRegisterGenerics(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: This method will write all required css classes to support the owner control. It also registers any Generic classes, so that they only have to be rendered one time. This cuts down on the size of the HTML output.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.MiscRenderBase.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Indicates whether this renderer will be used to provide DesignTime html.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler
member.summary: Drag this control onto your Web Form designer to administer Application Styling at the Page-level.

remarks.p: You can use the WebPageStyler control to inform the Application Styling Framework(tm) at the page-level about your selections for , and . These selections will override those made in the "web.config" file.
This control only applies to the Page-level, and should not be used in user controls or content templates.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default instance of the WebPageStyler control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.OnInit(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called back during the Init event in the ASP.NET page lifecycle.
member.param: Event arguments passed by ASP.NET, if any.

remarks.p: Inheritors must call the base class implementation of this method before adding their own functionality.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#DesignRefresh(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Called by Application Styling Framework(tm) to refresh the controls on the Page after a change.
member.param: The EnableAppStyling setting for the AppStylingManager
The StyleSet setting for the AppStylingManager
The StyleSetPath setting for the AppStylingManager

remarks.p: Application developers do not need to use this method. It has been implemented only to fulfill the requirements of the IProvideAppStyling interface.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Render(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Render this control to the output parameter specified.
member.param: The HTML writer to write out to

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.WebAgent
member.summary: Holds a reference to the Application Styling proxy object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the default themed appearance for controls on this Page that can support Application Styling.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: This property allows application developers to override the Application Styling style set that gets applied at the page-level, when their Web form contains a WebPageStyler control. This style set selection will override any style set name set in the application configuration (i.e., the "web.config" file) using the styleSetName attribute.
This style set name can be overridden by individual controls at the control-level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support for the Application Styling Framework(tm) to all controls on the current Page that can support Application Styling.
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled by default for all controls on the Page, False indicates Application Styling is disabled for all controls on the Page, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of Infragistics ASP.NET controls on this Page when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

Turn off support for Application Styling of Infragistics ASP.NET controls on this Page (even though it may have been enabled in the "web.config" file) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for controls on this Page that support Application Styling.

remarks.p: Setting this property at the page-level establishes a Page-level default that overrides any setting made at the application configuration level (i.e., in the "web.config" file) through the styleSetPath attribute.
The style set path specified by this property can still be overridden at the control-level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#StyleSheetFileName
member.summary: File name and path to the CSS stylesheet for this WebPageStyler control.

remarks.p: This property was included for legacy support only, and is not relevant to Application Styling.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#ParsedStyles
member.summary: Contains the ParsedStyleCollection consisting of CSS class definitions read from external sources.
member.value: The ParsedStyleCollection after external CSS class definitions have been parsed, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if parsing hasn't been performed yet.

remarks.p: Application developers do not need to use this property. It has been implemented only to fulfill the requirements of the IProvideAppStyling interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#StylePrefix
member.summary: Gets a string prefix value that is used within the CSS file to prefix each style class name.

remarks.p: Application developers do not need to use this property. It has been implemented only to fulfill the requirements of the IProvideAppStyling interface.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebPageStyler.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#ImageDirectory
member.summary: Directory location where images have been stored (not used).
member.value: Always returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET).

remarks.p: Application developers do not need to use this property. It has been implemented only to fulfill the requirements of the IProvideAppStyling interface.

member.summary: Displays the About box with information about this control, such as the version and build number.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Text which will be displayed for this control. The text will appear vertically centered with respect to the Top border. The horizontal alignment is controlled through the TextAlignment property.

member.summary: Controls the horizontal alignment of the Text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.ImageDirectory
member.summary: The directory where images are located.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.WebAgent
member.summary: Holds a reference to the app style proxy object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this WebGroupBox control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this WebGroupBox control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPageStyler control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igtr_AquaNode" and "igtr_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#StyleSheetFileName
member.summary: File name and path to the CSS stylesheet for this WebControl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#ParsedStyles
member.summary: Contains the ParsedStyleCollection consisting of CSS class definitions read from external sources.
member.value: The ParsedStyleCollection after external CSS class definitions have been parsed, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if parsing hasn't been performed yet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support on WebGroupBox for the Application Styling Framework(tm).
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled, False indicates Application Styling is disabled, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to page- or application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of WebGroupBox when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

When EnableAppStyling has it's default value of NotSet, this control will defer the determination of whether to use Application Styling to settings you make at the page- or application-level. Place the WebPageStyler control on the same Web form as this control to configure ASF support for all controls on that Page. ASF support can also be turned on application-wide with the enableAppStyling attribute in your "web.config" file.
Turn off support for the ASF in WebGroupBox (even though it may have been enabled at a higher level) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPageStyler control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.Infragistics#WebUI#Shared#IProvideAppStyling#StylePrefix
member.summary: Returns a string prefix value that is used within the CSS file to prefix each style class name. Can be overridden to change the prefix used for this control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.Misc.WebGroupBox.PresetMaskResourcePath
member.summary: Supports the Infragistics Preset architecture. For Infragistics Internal Use.
member.returns: The resource path of the xml file, used as the Preset Mask (Filter).
